dialogue.raw_text: What I told The Shooter goes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are you saying no before we've even discussed it? Am I to feel all my arguments will be wasted?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll skip to the final argument. (then) More salad, perhaps?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The Shooter will be back dealing when you start again. He will give you an occasional helpful card.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's an argument?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's a fact. I'm coming to the argument.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll give you a fact. I won't let it happen.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is that knife sharp enough? Felix.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: See if it cuts better with that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sharp?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Very. But it don't cut any ice with me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (rising) Not this time. He exits.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: As The Kid exits Christian is waiting for him. He moves down the corridor, preoccupied. She follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He stops, looks at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He looks at her a moment longer then moves up the corridor. She watches him, then turns. Standing in the open door some distance away are Schlaegel and Felix.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Did you eat?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (stops, looks at her irritated) Why not, for Chris sakes?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Eric -- THE KID (moving away) You should eat something.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (loudly, stopping) I've got to talk to you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Talk.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (fumbling) It's -- about us. What's going to happen?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (interrupting) What's going to happen? What's going to happen for Chris sake is I'm going to win the game. (then more softly) You go back to the apartment, honey, this might take two more days.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (flatly) If I go, I'm not going back to the apartment. If I go -- I'm just going.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (after a long moment) Well, that's up to you, Christian.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Shuffling the cards. CAMERA PULLS BACK enough to see his face as he looks across at The Kid. CAMERA PANS to a CLOSE SHOT of The Kid, and then past a couple of spectators, including Christian and Melba, to Bill, whose eyes are on The Kid. Finally CAMERA PANS back to The Kid.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I told you, Shooter -- I won't go for it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - INCLUDING BILL Both The Shooter and Bill are aware of a portentous note in The Kid's tone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lancey looks from The Kid to The Shooter, sensing that there may be something more behind this, but not knowing just what.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What's up?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The Shooter's not well. He didn't want to spoil the game, but he ought to be resting... He ought to be in the hospital.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, we got Lady Fingers. Or we can deal ourselves.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm okay. What The Kid's talking about is nothing. It's just not important.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It is to me... You want to kill yourself, do it on your own time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I got to go along with that, Shooter. Lady Fingers! You ready?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Rising from her chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (TIME LAPSE)
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Like Eddie the Dude said on his deathbed, I'm as ready as I'll ever be.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The four cards showing are the ace, ten and two little clubs. As CAMERA PULLS BACK we also have time to note The Kid's stake. He is still ahead. Lancey counts out five hundred dollars from his stake, leaving about thirteen thousand, and puts it into a pot that already contains around a thousand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Kid turns up the jack of clubs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Kid pulls in the money. (TIME LAPSE)
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I can't persuade myself you have the flush.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now I can.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Both men are showing the strain. Perhaps Lancey the most as he appears to be consistently losing. Showing are two nines and two odd cards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The kid turns up another nine and reaches for the money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (TIME LAPSE)
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) I'm going to pay the price to look at that third nine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Caveat emptor. New deck, please.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - FROM BEHIND THE KID He shows a pair of eights and two odd cards against Lancey's pair of queens. He takes another look at his hole card, and we see that it is of no help to him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Pair of eights bets an even thousand dollars.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: They are both sitting on the back of the loveseat now. The binoculars pass from one to the other. Both men are tense over the growing excitement of the game.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Ten bucks and my notoriously fallible instinct tells me the boy is bluffing this time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mark it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: to the other four remaining spectators: Christian, Melba, The Shooter and Bill. They are close enough to see the cards but too close to discuss them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The kid has almost half the money in front of him now, and is playing with increasing assurance and pressure.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (turning his cards) I'm not that curious.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: (excitement in his voice) The Kid is pushing it and making it stick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: to the other four spectators as they react to The Kid's successful streak.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And it looks that way. Lancey appears old and unsure. The Kid sharp and cold. A young barracuda moving in for the kill.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (in a low voice) He's getting to him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: in close to Christian as she tries to catch The Kid's eye. Thinking she has it, she smiles her encouragement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He looks right at her and doesn't seem to see her. Lady Fingers has dealt the first up cards of a new hand, and Lancey is high.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Two hundred.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And up five.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fold.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Amid the growing excitement and tension she is a complete outsider. (TIME LAPSE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Kid shows two jacks and two odd cards; Lancey a pair of aces and two odd cards. Lancey puts about eight hundred dollars into the pot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Kid exposes his hidden jack.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Betting the jack isn't there, Kid.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Greed and an almost vicious satisfaction marks their faces as they watch Lancey falter. The Shooter whispers to Bill just loud enough for the girl to hear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Christian looks at them, then at The Kid. Hesitates a moment then suddenly gets to her feet and starts for the door. Only Melba notices her, and even she doesn't have time to question her. CAMERA FOLLOWS Christian to the suite entrance, where she picks up her bag then turns to look back at the table.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: We're in -- I think he's got him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The place where Christian was sitting is right in his line of vision but he hasn't observed her departure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She goes on out the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: INCLUDING WINDOW The second dawn of the contest is near at hand. The room, continuously lived in for so long by so many people, is a shambles of dirty glasses and plates, empty bottles, full wastebaskets and ash trays, and frayed people. At the poker table, Lady Fingers is dealing a new hand.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: A jack and a ten. Jack bets.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: in close enough for us to see the cards. Lancey has the jack of hearts, The Kid the ten of clubs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Kid takes his first look at his hole card.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Jack is willing to wager two hundred dollars.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: It is the queen of hearts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lancey looks at him a long moment. His face pale and shaken. The Kid is beating him. Pushing -- buying -- always pressing and Lancey knows he is losing one hand at a time, not badly but consistently and inevitably. His age and fatigue are a strong handicap for the long pull. Then his face settles as if he had come to a decision. He smiles lightly summoning some last reserve of strength, almost as if he knows this will be the last hand, win or lose.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: And up five hundred.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Call your five hundred and five hundred more.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (after a brief hesitation) Call.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Fifty to one hundred says Lancey paired his jacks.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Mark it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Lady Fingers deals the ten of diamonds to The Kid, giving him a pair, and the ten of hearts to Lancey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The raise is a surprise. The Kid's eyes go up to study Lancey's face, even though he knows what a futile effort that is.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Pair of tens. Jack, ten of hearts.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Five hundred.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your five hundred -- and up one thousand.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Fifty to seventy-five he's got the jacks wired.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Mark it -- Could be a high heart. Queen's the best, but that old man can be cocky with an ace or a deuce. 'Specially having one of The Kid's tens.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: One thousand to the tens.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Call.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (dealing) A third ten, and a nine of hearts to the ten, jack.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: S The Kid, Lancey, Shooter, Melba, Schlaegel, Yeller, Hoban and others as they realize this could be the big hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lancey looks at him, then at the cards. The moment stretches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lancey looks at her. His face briefly showing his anger. The Kid notices this and reacts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Kid checks the amount of money in front of him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: He'll run. He's beat on the board anyway you look at it. Even if he has the jacks it is better than eight to one against improving.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He won't run and I don't think he's got the jacks. I think he's going for the flush.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (after a moment) Two thousand, five hundred dollars.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (finally) Two thousand, five hundred dollars to the three hearts.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (finally, casually) Reasonable bet. Two thousand five hundred. (he counts out the money to Lady Fingers) Deal them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (knowing this is it) He's going for it and The Kid's got him. He's going all the way.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (dealing) A queen of diamonds to the three tens. (a note of excitement in her voice) And an eight of hearts to the possible flush. Possible straight flush. Three tens bet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: They exchange a quick look of satisfaction, and then their eyes go back to the cards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They each take a quick turn with the binoculars.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: If The Kid bets into the flush he's filled up with a queen in the hole.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If The Man has a flush or a straight, he goes under. (then) But not with both.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: THE KID He looks at his hole card. It is still the queen of hearts. He has a full house, which has to be the winning hand unless Lancey had the audacity to bet out with a jack-seven of hearts, and to raise The Kid with a jack-ten-seven.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He counts out all his money except a few smaller bills.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Bet what's in front of me. Make it fifty-four hundred bucks.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Reacting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He takes his time before he responds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Slowly and deliberately, revealing nothing in his face, he reaches into his breast pocket and takes out a slim wallet and begins to let the bills flutter out on the table. The Kid looks at him frozen.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Fifty-four hundred bucks is a nice piece of money. (counting it out) I see the bet and raise sixty-seven hundred.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Bill hisses softly into The Shooter's ear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But The Shooter, like the Kid, is white-faced and frozen by the raise.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Kid has him, doesn't he?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: They crowd in close to the table: Hoban, Yeller, Bill, The Shooter, and Melba.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (after a long moment) I'm taking my half hour to raise my stake.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I declare a thirty-minute break. Leave your cards and money on the table. The game will start again at five forty-five.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll take your marker, Kid.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can raise it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know you can.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Long as you know. (he raps the table)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Call.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (turns up a heart seven) Straight flush to the jack -- That's $6700 you owe me, Kid.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: There is nothing to be gained from a poker face now, and he reacts with a stunned expression in which all the accumulated strain and fatigue is beginning to show. CAMERA MOVES among the spectators: Hoban and Yeller, who are sorry for The Kid and admiring of Lancey; Bill, who is all the more angry at his defeat because his hopes were up; The Shooter, who is a very unhappy man; and Melba, whose anger at the Kid is balanced by her fear of Schlaegel and what will happen to The Shooter and possibly to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lancey pulls in the money while The Kid stares at him dumbly. Lady Fingers riffles the cards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As he settles up, the CAMERA FOLLOWS The Kid to his brandy bottle. As he pours himself a slug, Melba and Shooter join him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: New deck.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are you playing, Kid? You got a half an hour to raise your stake.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No -- I'm through.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (formally) Gentlemen, this game is over.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're one hell of a poker player, Kid. That was a rough hand.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thanks.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's the tab for the whole show?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: R ANGLE MELBA You had to do it, didn't you -- you had to go for it your own way. (then, as The Kid doesn't answer) Well, sonny, I hope you learned something. I know we sure as hell did.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shooter looks at him a moment and nods, and taking Melba by the arm, moves toward the door followed by Felix.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Melba starts to protest, but Felix jerks her out the door. Shooter hesitates, then follows.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Where's Christian?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She's gone. She's got too much sense to stick with a two bit loser.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shut up. (then:) Sorry, Kid.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah. (then:) I should have known he had it, Shooter Man. I walked into it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (trying to grin as Schlaegel and Felix move up) Well, Kid, it's like I said -- you just wasn't ready.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to The Shooter) Are you ready, Shooter Man? We're having a meeting and I suggest you join us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why me -- I'm not part of this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (jerking her forward) Oh, yes you are -- you and your big mouth -- you're part of it all right.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's right, my dear. Now run along with Felix. We're going to have a long talk about that big mouth of yours.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Schlaegel turns to The Kid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Kid looks at him, looks at Lancey and Lady Fingers, wondering about what Schlaegel has said, angry about it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Schlaegel nods, moves to the door.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I was wrong. I figured you for brains. But you're a loser, Kid. You had a chance to play with grownups and you ran. (then, as Lancey and Lady Fingers approach) They weren't playing your game. They were playing mine. Think about that while you find a place to hide. But hide good, Kid -- because I got a message for you and I'm going to see it delivered.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Any time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Lancey and Lady Fingers join The Kid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Kid looks at him and doesn't answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He smiles his very pleasant smile and goes out the door.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Never thought I'd see the day. You raising tens on a lousy three-flush.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Gets down to what it's all about, doesn't it? Making the wrong play at the right time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sharply) That's what it's all about? (then, as Lancey looks at him and doesn't answer) You were crazy -- odds are three hundred to one against.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (after a moment) I don't play a percentage game. I play stud poker my way. And I got the money and you got the questions. Figure that out. (then, not unkindly) You're good. But as long as I'm around, you're second best, Kid... and you might as well learn to live with it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look me up if you're in Miami after Christmas. Stillson Hotel.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Lancey stops surrounded by a crowd of admirers offering their congratulations. The Kid watches for a moment then takes a long drink out of the bottle and eases through the crowd and out the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as The Kid moves down the hall and enters the elevator.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as he moves through the almost deserted lobby into the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LOUIS STREET - DAWN EFFECT SERIES OF ANGLES of the Kid walking alone through the city. During the above there is an impression someone is following him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns a corner and there is a man blocking his path. Suddenly three men move in behind him. He turns, trapped.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: EXT.
location: DESERTED STREET NEAR THE KID'S APARTMENT

direction.raw_text: R ANGLE The men are four of the original seven players he hustled in the opening scene.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : During the progression of the game first one, then two, then all four men will be included among the observers. Always in the background, never positively identified. Their presence should be felt if not recognized.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He moves toward The Kid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The men hesitate.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: So it ain't Eric Stone, from the foundry. It's the Cincinnati Kid King of the stud poker players.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No -- not the King -- not much of anything right now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (moving towards him) We'll start with giving you back what you gave me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Eric --
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: as Christian gets out of a taxi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He crosses to Christian.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (as she moves toward them) Tell her good-bye, sport. You ain't going any place.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are you all right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: R ANGLE THE KID I'm fine. (then) Weren't you going to say good-bye?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Christian doesn't answer. She looks at The Kid for a long moment, then turns and goes. He watches her. She enters the cab and it leaves. The Kid just stands there.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I said good-bye.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, I guess you did. (then) You don't know if I won or lost do you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No -- it doesn't really matter. (then after a long moment) I love you, Kid -- and it's not enough.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, I know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (calling) Listen, Lady, it's coming on the morning rush. I got to have one fare after another or I'm behind for the day.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Danny and the others move up around him. The Kid ignores them. After a moment Danny swings from behind and knocks him to the pavement. He lies there stunned for a moment. They look down at him. Then he comes up. He flattens two in the process of being badly beaten. They leave him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: S as the city awakens. Finally, he stirs, stands and walks away.
direction.name: direction
